A short time ago, at least two Russian KAB glide-bombs launched from a Su-34 struck the Korobelnyi District of Kherson City. At the time, 3 reconnaissance drones were operating over the eastern suburbs of the city. Power outages were subsequently reported.

Earlier today, a Russian Iskander-M ballistic missile launched from Millerovo Airbase, Rostov oblast, impacted the city of Slovyansk, Donetsk Oblast.
Media 1 shows the aftermath, but the exact target is currently unknown. No civilian casualties were reported.

Military Situation In Syria On October 14, 2025 (Map Update)

Kurdish Leader Announces Breakthrough In Talks With Damascus, But War Seems Closer 
Commander-in-Chief of the Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF), Mazloum Abdi, said that a ‚Äúpreliminary agreement‚Äù on several issues, including a comprehensive ceasefire and the continuation of high-level dialogue, was reached with Syria‚Äôs Islamist-led Interim Government.
Abdi made the surprising remarks during an interview with the Kurdish Ronahi TV that was aired on October 11. He said that met separately in Damascus with the Minister of Defense and the head of the intelligence service, noting that there was ‚Äúan understanding on the principle of decentralization‚Äù in governance, with ongoing discussions about the interpretation of related terms.
Abdi‚Äôs recent remarks show a lot of optimism, but the situation on the ground indicates that a battle between the SDF and the government is nearing.

Another Day, Another Step Back For Kiev Forces In Pokrovsk (Videos)
The slow, but steady, collapse of Ukrainian defenses continues in Pokrovsk, according to reports from October 14, with the Russian military expanding its operations inside and around the city in the Donetsk direction.
The Tsentr [Center] Group of Forces has reportedly made more gains in the Dobropillia salient, to the northeast of Pokrovsk.
Back to the area around Pokrovsk, the Tsentr Group of Forces captured Balagan, according to the Russian Ministry of Defense.

Russian Army Maneuvers To Isolate Seversk, Advance In Several Areas In Kharkiv (Videos)
The Russian military is once again advancing close to Seversk and Krasny Liman in the Donetsk direction, according to reports from October 14, which also indicate gains in several areas in the direction of Kharkiv.
The Yug [South] Group of Forces is reported storming Dronivka, to the northwest of Seversk. It is unclear yet if Russian troops have secured a foothold inside the settlement, but the advance in this area could end up causing the collapse of Ukrainian defenses nearby.
Moving to the north, in Kharkiv, the Sever [North] Group of Forces has reportedly made some gains in at least two different areas.

Review of Ukrainian-Russian Strikes. Kyiv Without Power, Odesa Without a Mayor
On the night of October 13-14, the Russian armed forces launched a series of strikes which, according to the Russian Ministry of Defense, were focused on targeting transport and fuel-and-energy infrastructure facilities used in the interests of the Ukrainian Armed Forces
.
Throughout the day, power outages were recorded in more than seven regions of Ukraine. By the evening, several districts of Kyiv, including the city center, were left without electricity. According to reports, these disruptions were caused by accidents on high-voltage power lines. Repair work is underway, but the timeline for full restoration remains unknown.
Most likely, the "accident on the high-voltage lines" reported by DTEK is not a local incident, but a systemic consequence of recent strikes by Russian forces on CHP-5, the loss of reserves at CHP-6, and the degradation of the 330 kV backbone following attacks...

Tightening The Noose: Ukrainian Troops Are Becoming Increasingly Isolated In Pokrovsk
Russian forces are advancing towards the Pokrovsk grouping, aiming to split it and encircle the entire agglomeration. Russian units have broken through into the south-eastern part of Dronivka, close to the railway line. 
United States Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has called on European countries to increase pressure on Russia and third countries purchasing Russian oil.
